content:
• Friday, December 21, 2018
  • MRNS

    IAG, AVAV, GAIN and MRNS among notable after hour movers

    • Top Gainers: MRNS +8.7%. CMCT +4.8%.EVER +4.3%. LOOP +3.8%. GAIN +3.4%.
    • Top Losers: DBVT -14.1%. IAG -4.7%. AVAV -4.4%. GSS -2.2%. OBLN -1.9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:51 PM | 2 Comments
  • NKE

    Nike +7% as earnings beat, China strength spark bullish analyst calls

    • Nike (NKE +7.2%) is far and away today's strongest Dow Jones performer after beating expectations for both FQ2 earnings and revenues and forecasting currency neutral FY 2019 revenue rising in the high single-digits and potentially approaching low double-digit growth.
    • Despite concerns over the trade dispute with China, NKE's quarterly revenue growth accelerated to 31%, with CFO Andrew Campion saying "we have not seen any impact on our business."
    • Shares were upgraded today at various firms, including J.P. Morgan and Pivotal Research, as analysts approved of NKE's strategies to maintain momentum with a robust pipeline of products.
    • JPM's Matthew Boss raised his rating to Overweight after staying at Neutral for the past 18 months while reiterating his $85 price target and seeing an attractive entry point for investors.
    • Pivotal's Mitch Kummetz hiked his rating to Buy from Hold, saying the results show the Nike brand "continues to outperform its primary competition," primarily Adidas ([[addyy]], OTCQX:ADDDF) and Under Armour (NYSE:UA).
    • Susquehanna’s Sam Pose reiterated his Buy rating and $100 stock price target, as "improvements in the scarcity model, the speed of the product pipeline and digitally driven consumer engagement are still in their early stages and should continue for the foreseeable future."
     
     
     
     
    | 4:33 PM | 12 Comments

  • Stocks close down near session lows

    • U.S. stock markets continued their downward slope, after a brief rally sparked by New York Fed President John Williams comments, closing near session lows as the looming partial government shutdown dominated headlines for much of the afternoon.
    • S&P fell 2.1% and Nasdaq slid 3.0%.
    • FAANG stocks led the decline--Facebook -6.3%, Amazon -5.7%, Apple -3.9%, Netflix -5.5%, and Google -3.2%.
    • Tech (-2.8%) and consumer services (-2.6%) suffered the most, while defensive sectors basic materials (-0.9%) and utilities (-0.9%) declined the least.
    • Oil fell 1.1% to $45.37; gold fell 0.7%.
    • 10-year Treasury yield fell almost 3 basis points to 2.78%.
    • The U.S. Dollar Index rose 0.7% to 97.02.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:32 PM | 64 Comments
  • PSEC

    Pockets of green show up in BDCs, mREITs

    • The S&P 500 sank another 2% today (and the Nasdaq 3%), but - unlike previous selloffs this week - investors were doing some buying (or at least less selling) in the BDC and mREIT sectors.
    • Among those performing relatively well: Prospect Capital (PSEC +0.8%), Hercules Capital (HTGC), Oxford Lane (OXLC +4.4%), PennantPark (PNNT +0.6%), Blackrock Capital (BKCC -0.3%), Goldman Sachs BDC (GSBD +0.7%), Gladstone Capital (GLAD +2.3%), KCAP Financial (KCAP +2.9%), Annaly (NLY -0.2%), AGNC Investment (AGNC +0.1%), Two Harbors (TWO -0.2%), Orchid Island (ORC +1.5%), New York Mortgage (NYMT -0.2%), Invesco (IVR +1.4%), Anworth (ANH), Ellington Financial (EFC +1.1%)
    • ETFs: MORL, REM, BDCL, MORT, BDCS, BIZD, FGB, LBDC
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM | 105 Comments

  • Panicky action sends Nasdaq down almost 3%, S&P 2%

    • The Fed today sent out two of its hawkish-leaning members to try and assure markets it's willing to change to a more dovish course, if necessary.
    • It worked for a bit, but the selling began anew, and picked up steam throughout the afternoon. The Nasdaq looks set to close down about 3% and the S&P 500 2%.
    • The 10-year Treasury yield is down 2.7 basis points to 2.78%.
    • Gold was down 0.8% and oil 1.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:00 PM | 173 Comments
  • MRIN

    Microcaps dominate tech movers

    • Gainers: Marin Software (NASDAQ:MRIN) +39%. Castlight Health (NYSE:CSLT) +8%. Park City Group (NYSEMKT:PCYG) +7%. Maxwell Technologies (NASDAQ:MXWL) +7%. JD.com (NASDAQ:JD) +6%.
    • Losers: Inpixon (NASDAQ:INPX) -20%. Windstream Holdings (NASDAQ:WIN) -18%. Superconductor Technologies (NASDAQ:SCON) -15%. The9 Limited (NASDAQ:NCTY) -13%. Clearfield (NASDAQ:CLFD) -13%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:00 PM | 3 Comments
  • SBGL

    AMCU strike at Sibanye-Stillwater is legal, South African court says

    • Sibanye-Stillwater (SBGL -5.6%) turns sharply lower after a South African says a strike by a union representing just under half of all workers at its gold operations in the country is legal, despite the company declaring otherwise last week.
    • The court disagreed with SBGL’s reason for judging the strike unprotected and ordered the miner to pay for the costs of the case, according to the AMCU union.
    • SBGL declared the AMCU strike, which has been ongoing since mid-November, illegal last week; if the court found in its favor, the company could have taken disciplinary action against workers that did not show up to work.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:59 PM | 11 Comments
  • JD

    JD founder won't be charged; JD +5%

    • JD.com (NASDAQ:JD) gains 5.4% after headlines attributed to DJ say founder Liu Qiangdong won't be charged in the Minnesota sexual assault case.
    • More information when available.
    • Update:
    • Key quote from the Hennepin County Attorney’s Office: “There were profound evidentiary problems which would have made it highly unlikely that any criminal charge could be proven beyond a reasonable doubt."
    • Source: WSJ.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:48 PM | 85 Comments
  • HMLP

    Hoegh LNG grabs long-term FSRU charter deal with Australia's AGL

    • Hoegh LNG Partners (HMLP +2%) is higher after Australian energy retailer AGL says it signed a long-term charter with the company for a floating storage and regasification unit to be deployed at its proposed liquefied natural gas import project at Crib Point in Victoria state.
    • The deal for the Hoegh Giant will bring a modern vessel constructed last year by Hyundai Heavy Industries.
    • AGL says the FSRU agreement is conditional on a final investment decision and regulatory approvals for the overall project, adding that the vessel also will be part of an ongoing environmental assessment process.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:46 PM | 15 Comments
  • GS

    Goldman's Solomon defends firm's culture amid 1MDB probe: Bloomberg

    • Goldman Sachs (GS -4.2%) CEO David Solomon defends the bank's culture and compliance processes amid fallout from the probe surrounding Malyasia's 1MDB fund, Bloomberg reports.
    • In a year-end message to Goldman's employees, Solomon says, "We believe our culture and our processes around our due diligence and compliance was strong at the time and even stronger today."
    • The statement comes after Malaysia filed the first criminal charge against Goldman, alleging that the bank made untrue statements and omitted key facts in offering documents for the bonds it sold for the state fund.
    • Goldman has consistently denied wrongdoing.
    • Goldman's down 36% YTD, compared with the 17% declined for S&P 500 Financials Sector Index.
    • Previously: Malaysia seeks $7.5B in reparations from Goldman (Dec. 21)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:15 PM | 22 Comments
  • CCLP

    CSI Compressco leads Energy/Materials gainers; Emerge Energy Services and Amyris among losers

    • Gainers: CSI Compressco (NASDAQ:CCLP) +9%. Sanchez Midstream Partners (NYSEMKT:SNMP) +8%. CARBO Ceramics (NYSE:CRR) +8%. Ossen Innovation (NASDAQ:OSN) +7%. Kosmos Energy (NYSE:KOS) +6%.
    • Losers: Emerge Energy Services (NYSE:EMES) -16%. Chaparral Energy (NYSE:CHAP) -12%. New Concept Energy (NYSEMKT:GBR) -12%. Pioneer Energy Services (NYSE:PES) -9% Amyris (NASDAQ:AMRS) -9%
     
     
     
     
    | 2:10 PM | 8 Comments
  • EBIX

    Ebix -2.5% on stock split delay

    • Ebix (NASDAQ:EBIX) will delay its planned stock split due to the decline in the share price since September. The split will now happen after the price rebounds to a level where the split would result in a higher post-split price.
    • The company says it may consider implementing an alternate split ratio such as two-, three- or four-for one.
    • Ebix shares are down 2.5% to $40.29.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:52 PM | 8 Comments
  • WHLR

    Wheeler REIT plunges 28% after suspending preferred dividends

    • Wheeler Real Estate Investment Trust (NASDAQ:WHLR) plunges 28% after the REIT says it won't pay Q4 dividends on its preferred stock "at this time," citing its ongoing review of strategic alternatives.
    • Plans to accelerate efforts to reduce short-term, higher-cst debt where accretive and complete strategic dispositions and refinancings, which continuing efforts to improve portfolio occupancy.
    • The board will re-evaluate the payment of preferred dividends for Q1 2019 when appropriate.
    • Previously: Wheeler REIT +2.7% after selling two assets and reducing debt (Oct. 23)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:22 PM | 36 Comments
  • PRGO

    Perrigo plunges to nine-year lows on news of €1.64B Irish tax dispute

    • Perrigo (PRGO -26.3%) plummets as much as 27% to nine-year lows following the disclosure of a €1.64B (~$1.9B) bill for back taxes in Ireland.
    • The assessment is among the largest in Ireland’s history, and PRGO says it will "pursue all available administrative and judicial avenues as may be necessary or appropriate."
    • “Given the tax authority makes the rules, it seems reasonable to think they may have the upper hand in this argument,” says Wells Fargo health care analyst David Maris, who cuts his price target for PRGO shares to $46 from $64.
    • Maris questioned why it took so long for PRGO to tell investors when the assessment came at the end of November; after talking with company management, he says the company was “exhausting all options including getting more clarification” before making it public.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:09 PM | 5 Comments
  • EHTH

    Day two of gains for eHealth after positive sell-side coverage

    • George Hill and team at RBC yesterday initiated coverage on eHealth (NASDAQ:EHTH) with an Outperform rating and $57 price target.
    • The company, says RBC is highly leveraged to Medicare Advantage growth, and sports an attractive relative valuation to peers.
    • After about a 6% rise yesterday, shares are up modestly again today to $36.84.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:08 PM
  • YRIV

    First Guaranty Bancshares among financial gainers; Wheeler Real Estate Investment Trust leads losers

    • Gainers: Yangtze River Port and Logistics (NASDAQ:YRIV) +7%. First Guaranty Bancshares (NASDAQ:FGBI) +7%. CBL & Associates Properties (NYSE:CBL) +6%. Pennsylvania Real Estate Investment Trust (NYSE:PEI) +6%. GAMCO Investors (NYSE:GBL) +6%.
    • Losers: Wheeler Real Estate Investment Trust (NASDAQ:WHLR) -25%. EverQuote (NASDAQ:EVER) -10%. Camping World Holdings (NYSE:CWH) -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:02 PM | 5 Comments
  • NFEC

    Microcaps dominate midday movers

    • Gainers: NF Energy Saving (NASDAQ:NFEC) +39%. Obalon Therapeutics (NASDAQ:OBLN) +37%. Marin Software Incorporated (NASDAQ:MRIN) +28%. BioHiTech Global (NASDAQ:BHTG) +21%. Dova Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:DOVA) +21%. Spectrum Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:SPPI) +18%. Translate Bio (NASDAQ:TBIO) +15%. ChromaDex (NASDAQ:CDXC) +14%. Shiloh Industries (NASDAQ:SHLO) +13%. CSI Compressco (NASDAQ:CCLP) +13%.
    • Losers: TRACON Pharmaceuticals, Inc. (NASDAQ:TCON) -38%. Benitec Biopharma (NASDAQ:BNTC) -30%. GEE Group (NYSEMKT:JOB) -29%. Therapix Biosciences (NASDAQ:TRPX) -28%. Perrigo Company plc (NASDAQ:PRGO) -26%. Wheeler Real Estate Investment Trust (NASDAQ:WHLR) -25%. New Age Beverages (NASDAQ:NBEV) -19%. CRISPR Therapeutics AG (NASDAQ:CRSP) -18%. Inpixon (NASDAQ:INPX) -18%. Sphere 3D (NASDAQ:ANY) -17%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:41 PM | 4 Comments
  • C

    Citi slips after Credit Suisse sees Q4 hit by weaker trading

    • Citigroup (NYSE:C) slides 2.3% after Credit Suisse analyst Susan Roth Katzke cuts her Q4 EPS estimate to $1.55 from $1.64.
    • Seasonally slower Q4 is showing prices and activity levels indicating trading revenue will be weaker, especially in fixed income, than Credit Suisse had previously expected, she writes in a note.
    • Keeps rating at outperform with price target of $80.
    • Citigroup has fallen 31% YTD, compared with S&P 500 Banks Industry Group Index is down 20% in that same period.
    • Source: Bloomberg First Word.
    • Analyst ratings: 19 buys; 8 holds; 1 underperform/sell.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:24 PM | 8 Comments
  • CYTR

    CytRx +4.2% after concluding LADR preclinical phase

    • Nano cap CytRx (NASDAQ:CYTR) rises 4.2% in midday trading after the company ends its preclinical phase of development of its albumin binding ultra high potency LADR drug candidates and for its albumin companion diagnostic (ADCx).
    • Operations at its preclinical lab in Freiburg, Germany, is no longer needed. As a result, cash burn will be reduced.
    • Seeking a strategic transaction for LADR and ACDx assets, "with the goal of executing such a transaction as soon as possible."
    • The company's LADR platform combines its proprietary linker chemistry with albumin biology to create anticancer molecules that CytRx believes will deliver highly potent agents directly to the tumor, while avoiding unacceptable systemic toxicity.
    • In vitro, in vivo, stability, and manufacturing feasibility testing is now complete for all four lead LADR candidates as well for ACDx.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:06 PM | 5 Comments
  • PCG

    Key California legislator wants shakeup for PG&E board, execs

    • A California state senator who co-wrote a law to help PG&E (PCG -3.9%) pay for last year’s wildfires now says leadership changes are necessary after state regulators last week accused the utility of falsifying natural gas pipeline safety records.
    • “This latest revelation underscores the need for systematic change, which must include change on the board of directors and in the executive suite,” says State Sen. Dodd of Napa, adding that California regulators likely will issue recommendations related to PG&E’s management in the “coming days.”
    • PG&E already was under scrutiny as investigators probe whether its equipment sparked last month’s Camp Fire, the state’s deadliest on record.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:06 PM | 17 Comments
  • NKE

    Nike leads consumer gainers; Energous and Origin Agritech among losers

    • Gainers: NIKE (NYSE:NKE) +7%. Ballantyne Strong (NYSEMKT:BTN) +5%.
    • Losers: New Age Beverages (NASDAQ:NBEV) -13%. Calyxt (NASDAQ:CLXT) -14%. Origin Agritech (NASDAQ:SEED) -11%. Energous (NASDAQ:WATT) -10%. Cryoport (NASDAQ:CYRX) -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:01 PM | 2 Comments
  • FB

    Facebook -5% on crypto plans, DZ Bank downgrade

    • Facebook (NASDAQ:FB) shares are down 4.8% on plans to develop cryptocurrency for WhatsApp and a downgrade from German broker DZ Bank, which shifts FB from Hold to Sell and drops its target from $145 to $115.
    • The broker cites management's continued missteps and questionable business model. The target cut is due to the possibility that advertisers will pull from the platform due to the controversies.
    • Analyst Ingo Wermann sees the possibility for a fresh start under new management.
    • Source: Bloomberg First Word.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:54 AM | 139 Comments

  • Tech lunch: Semis green, but Nasdaq lower

    • The tech sector (NYSEARCA:XLK) is down 0.5% after the temporary rally following NYFRB President John Williams's comments that the Fed is always willing to re-assess its outlook.
    • The Philadelphia Semiconductor Index is up 0.7% after Needham came out positive on the industry. The S&P 500 IT index is down 0.3% and the tech-heavy Nasdaq 100 is down 0.8%.
    • Related semi ETFs: SOXL, SOXX, SMH, USD, PSI, XSD, SOXS, SSG, FTXL, XTH
     
     
     
     
    | 11:44 AM
  • TSG

    Stars Group's $870M judgement reversed

    • The Stars Group (NASDAQ:TSG) announces the complete reversal of the $870M judgement issued in December 2015.
    • The litigation was originally filed by the Commonwealth of Kentucky seeking recovery of alleged losses by residents playing real-money poker games on the PokerStars website. Stars Group acquired PokerStars four years later.
    • The Stars Group now plans to petition for the release of the $100M supersedeas bond.
    • TSG shares were halted ahead of the news and will resume trading at 11:40 ET.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:20 AM | 5 Comments
  • EDIT

    Editas Medicine -11% as CFO Hack to step down

    • Editas Medicine (EDIT -11.3%) plunges to a 52-week low after saying CFO Andrew Hack plans to step down effective March 1 to return to the investment industry.
    • Hack joined EDIT in July 2015 from Millennium Management, where he ran a healthcare fund focused on biotech, pharmaceutical and medical device companies; previously, he was a healthcare analyst at HealthCor Management, Carlyle-Blue Wave Partners and MPM BioEquities Fund.
    • EDIT says a search is underway to find a successor to Hack.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:12 AM | 30 Comments
  • OBLN

    Spectrum Pharmaceuticals among healthcare gainers; TRACON Pharmaceuticals and Perrigo among losers

    • Gainers: Obalon Therapeutics (NASDAQ:OBLN) +41%. Dova Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:DOVA) +21%. Translate Bio (NASDAQ:TBIO) 20%. Spectrum Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:SPPI) +18%.  Check-Cap (NASDAQ:CHEK) +15%.
    • Losers: TRACON Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:TCON) -29%. Perrigo Company (NASDAQ:PRGO) -24%. Therapix Biosciences (NASDAQ:TRPX) -16%. Benitec Biopharma (NASDAQ:BNTC) -15%. Zomedica Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ZOM) -12%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:06 AM
  • FL

    Foot Locker +4% following strong Nike quarter; Jefferies analyst says buy

    • Foot Locker (FL +4.7%) follows Nike with strong gains after the latter reported better than expected FQ2 results and raised its constant currency sales and gross margin guidance for FY 2019.
    • Jefferies analyst Janine Stichter recommends buying FL on NKE's "resurging" North America business, as NKE's strong quarter points to top-line momentum continuing to build, particulalry in North America, where 9% constant currency growth accelerated from 6% in Q1.
    • Given the nearly 80% correlation between Nike North America sales and FL same-store-sales, the accelerating fundamentals are a "clear positive" for FL, Stichter says, maintaining a Buy rating and $62 price target.
    • Source: Briefing.com
     
     
     
     
    | 11:03 AM
  • PCH

    PotlatchDeltic to sell El Dorado MDF for $92M

    • PotlatchDeltic (PCH +3.6%) agrees to sell its El Dorado medium-density fiberboard business to Roseburg Forest Products for $92M in cash and assumption of revenue bond obligations.
    • The price consists of $63M in cash and the assumption of $29M of revenue bond obligations.
    • “We obtained this well-positioned MDF business through our recent merger with Deltic Timber. The sale of MDF focuses our Arkansas operations on timberlands and lumber while enhancing shareholder value,” said Mike Covey, chairman and CEO.
    • Sees using proceeds for general purposes.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:55 AM
  • STML

    Stemline -9% on FDA approval with Boxed Warning

    • The FDA approves Stemline Therapeutics' (NASDAQ:STML) Elzonris infusion for the treatment of blastic plasmacytoid dendritic cell neoplasm in adults and in pediatric patients aged two years or older.
    • The approval comes with a Boxed Warning for increased risk of capillary leak syndrome, which may be life-threatening or fatal.
    • STML shares are down 9% to $7.89.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:39 AM | 12 Comments
  • RFIL

    RF Industries +2% post Q4 results

    • RF Industries (RFIL +2.8%) reported Q4 net sales increase in 40.7% Y/Y to $9.98M, primarily driven by increased sales at the Custom Cabling Manufacturing and Assembly (Custom Cabling) segment.
    • Q4 Gross margin declined by 160 bps to 29.8% and operating margin improved by 624 bps to 11.3%.
    • Backlog was $11M at October 31, 2018 and bookings of $13M.
    • S&G expenses were $1.58M an increase of 4.9% from last year and margin declined by 766 bps to 15.9%.
    • Company reported working capital of $23.8M, including cash and cash equivalents of $16.3M, a current ratio of 6-to-1, no outstanding debt, and stockholders' equity of $27.8M.
    • Net cash provided by operating activities from continuing operations was $5.27M, compared to $786k a year ago.
    • Previously: RF Industries reports Q4 results (Dec. 20)
    • 10-K
     
     
     
     
    | 10:34 AM
  • ICHR

    Ichor +1.4% as Needham says Buy

    • Needham's positive initiation of the semi industry starts Ichor Holdings (NASDAQ:ICHR) at Buy and a $22 price target.
    • The firm cites "compelling value" at the current price and expects the company to resume growth in 2H19 with the improve WFE spending environment.
    • Source: Bloomberg First Word.
    • Ichor shares are up 1.4% to $16.05.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:31 AM | 3 Comments
  • MO

    Altria cut to Sell at Citi, as price paid for Juul stake is 'destroying value'

    • Altria (MO -2%) tumbles after Citi downgrades shares to Sell from Neutral with a $45 price target, cut from $67, as analyst Adam Spielman says MO's $12.8B investment for a 35% stake in Juul "is destroying value."
    • MO is effectively signaling doubts about the future of its core cigarette business, Spielman says, and the deal weakens MO's existing business as it allows Juul to directly contact the company's current consumers to try to persuade them to switch from Marlboro to Juul.
    • Morgan Stanley's Pamela Kaufman also thinks MO's move comes at a high price, noting the $38B valuation represents more than double the $16B valuation that Juul received in an investment round last summer.
    • Kaufman, who maintains his Equal Weight rating and $54 price target on MO, also sees risk in MO's lack of operating control and the potential for further FDA regulation.
    • Stifel analyst Christopher Growe calls the $38B valuation "unusually high" and believes the price paid offsets most of the future potential benefit from the addition of JUUL, while Deutsche Bank's Steve Powers says the deal is "not the holiday gift we'd hoped for."
     
     
     
     
    | 10:28 AM | 209 Comments
  • LRCX

    Lam Research +2.9% on Needham New Buy

    • Needham initiates Lam Research (NASDAQ:LRCX) at Buy with a $180 price target as part of the firm's positive view on the semi industry.
    • The firm calls Lam "attractively priced" and says the company "stands to benefit from the increasing etch and deposition intensity associated with 3D NAND and multi-patterning."
      • Source: Bloomberg First Word.
      • Lam Research shares are up 2.9% to $131.99.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:26 AM | 4 Comments

  • Stocks boosted as Fed's Williams walks back FOMC results

    • Markets 1, Fed 0.
    • The central bank has moved quickly to walk back Wednesday's FOMC policy statement and Powell press conference, sending FRBNY President John Williams to CNBC to promise to "listen carefully" to the market. The Fed, says Williams, stands ready to "re-assess" its view.
    • The S&P 500 (SPY +1.1%), DJIA (DIA +1.3%), and Nasdaq (QQQ +0.6%)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:26 AM | 238 Comments
  • AMAT

    AMAT +2% on new Buy rating

    • Needham initiates Applied Materials (NASDAQ:AMAT) at Buy with a $45 target as the firm starts the semi industry with a positive outlook.
    • Analyst N. Quinn Bolton calls AMAT a "clear beneficiary" in the expected capital spending recovery in 2H19.
    • Bolton says AMAT is less volatile than its peers due to its balanced exposure to logic/foundry and memory.
    • Source: Bloomberg First Word.
    • AMAT shares are up 1.9% to $31.50.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:22 AM | 7 Comments
  • GLNG

    Golar LNG +6% after BP takes FID on Tortue phase 1

    • Golar LNG (GLNG +6.2%) pops in early trading following BP's final investment decision on Tortue's phase 1 development, which will utilize one of GLNG's floating liquefied natural gas vessels.
    • Cowen analysts estimate the project is worth $10/share unlevered and $13/share levered to GLNG, a positive catalyst given each FLNG vessel represents significant value.
    • Cowen maintains its Outperform rating and $41 target for GLNG, which contemplates an additional Tortue FLNG vessel.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:14 AM | 7 Comments
  • OBLN

    Obalon +56% on FDA approval

    • Obalon Therapeutics (NASDAQ:OBLN) gains 55.5% after announcing the FDA approval for its Navigation System, which removes the need for an x-ray when placing the Obalon Balloon System obesity treatment. The Navigation System instead uses magnetic resonance.
    • Commercial availability of the Navigation System is expected in Q1.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:00 AM | 3 Comments
  • BXMT

    Deutsche Bank defends CRE REITs

    • The slide in commercial real estate REITs of ~8%-10% this week was overdone and may be the result of retail investors as some retail-heavy high-yield "buckets" have come uner pricing pressure in the last four sessions, writes Deutsche Bank analyst George Bahamondes.
    • Upgrades Blackstone Mortgage Trust (BXMT +2.3%), Arbor Realty Trust (ABR +2.4%) to buy.
    • BDCs, mortgage REITs, and leverage loan indexes were "hit especially hard."
    • Points out Starwood Property Trust (STWD +1.7%), BXMT, Apollo Commercial Real Estate Finance (ARI +1.6%), Ladder Capital (LADR +1.8%), TPG RE Finance Trust (TRTX +1.5%), ABR pay average dividend yield of 9.6% with valuations at or near level where there's been stock buyback activity.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:59 AM | 13 Comments
  • TCEHY

    NetEase +7% as China approves first games

    • A senior official with China's government watchdog says the first batch of game approvals had been completed.
    • Feng Shixin: "We are working on the release of new licenses. Given the large number of new titles in the pipeline, it might take some time."
    • The State Administration of Radio and Television watchdog hadn't approved any new games since March due to restructuring. The freeze hit Tencent (OTCPK:TCEHY) particularly hard with the gaming giant reporting its first quarterly profit drop in 13 years.
    • Analysts still see headwinds for the industry. IHS Markit's Cui Chenyu: "Restarting license approval does not mean that Chinese regulators will ease up on gaming control. In fact, we believe Beijing will further regulate the content of video games. That, in turn, will drive up gaming companies' production costs."
    • NetEase (NASDAQ:NTES) shares are up 6.9% to $252.18 on the news.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:49 AM | 5 Comments
  • CDXC

    NKE, NTES and CDXC among premarket gainers

    • ChromaDex (NASDAQ:CDXC) +16% on pact with Nestlé Health Science
    • Level Brands (NYSEMKT:LEVB) +15% on closing acquisition of Nationally Recognized Health & Wellness Brand cbdMD.
    • Tel-Instrument Electronics (NYSEMKT:TIK) +11% on announcing $1.6M Mode 5 Test set order.
    • NIKE (NYSE:NKE) +9% on Q2 earnings.
    • Immunomedics (NASDAQ:IMMU) +6%.
    • NetEase (NASDAQ:NTES) +5%.

  • PBR

    Petrobras suspends new divestments in oil exploration or production

    • Petrobras (NYSE:PBR) -2% pre-market after saying it will suspend any new divestment initiatives in oil exploration or production, following a Supreme Court decision that suspended an agreement between the company and the Brazilian government that helped shield it from liability as it seeks to dispose of ~$27B in assets to help raise cash to pay down debt.
    • The divestment program is seen as crucial to PBR’s growth in the future, and the company says sale initiatives started before May 2018 should not be affected.
    • Separately, PBR says it has suspended oil and refined products trading with Vitol after Brazilian federal prosecutors charged 12 people in connection with an alleged bribery scheme meant to benefit the oil trading house.

  • TCON

    TRACON Pharmaceuticals' Phase 2 TRAXAR trial fails to meet primary endpoints; shares down 21% premarket

    • TRACON Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:TCON) announces that its Phase 2 TRAXAR trial evaluating TRC105 in combination with Inlyta (axitinib) in patients with advanced or metastatic renal cell carcinoma did not meet the primary endpoint of improving progression free survival (PFS) in the intent to treat population compared to Inlyta monotherapy.
    • Prespecified statistical analyses of PFS, TGFβ receptor III and osteopontin, also did not achieve statistical significance.
    • Data from this study will be analyzed and submitted for presentation at an upcoming scientific congress.
    • The TRAXAR trial enrolled 150 patients. Key secondary endpoints included objective response rate, safety and tolerability.
    • Shares are down 21% premarket.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:19 AM | 2 Comments
